Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.name: allInterfaces()
Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.abstract: Returns all network interfaces in your system. If you have an interface name (e.g. en0) that has

Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.name: createTestDummy(_:family:address:multicastSupported:broadcastAddress:)
Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.abstract: Returns a new Interface instance that does not represent a real network interface, but can be used for (unit) testing.

Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.name: init(name:family:address:netmask:running:up:loopback:multicastSupported:broadcastAddress:)
Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.abstract: Initialize a new Interface with the given properties.

Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.name: addressBytes
Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.abstract: Creates the network format representation of the interface’s IP address. Wraps inet_pton.

Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.name: address
Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.abstract: Extracted from ifaddrs->ifa_addr, supports both IPv4 and IPv6.

Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.name: netmask
Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.abstract: Extracted from ifaddrs->ifa_netmask, supports both IPv4 and IPv6.

Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.name: debugDescription
Classes/Interface.html#/s:8NetUtils9Inte.abstract: Returns a string containing a few properties of the Interface.

Classes/Interface.html.name: Interface
Classes/Interface.html.abstract: This class represents a network interface in your system. For example, en0 with a certain IP address.
